definition: lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
variant of 乾[qian2]
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)
surname Qian
old variant of 乾[qian2]
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing earth/female principle/☷/ancient Chinese compass point: 225° (southwest)
variant of 坤[kun1]

sentences.english: A challenge is nothing but an opportunity turned upside down.
sentences.chinese: 挑战，无他，仅是一次扭转乾坤的机会。

sentences.english: Just this little twist can make all the difference.
sentences.chinese: 其实小小的转变就可以扭转乾坤。

definition: to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); snatching victory from the jaws of defeat
perilous situation
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
lost game/losing battle
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
to win by a surprise move
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
